results.title: Implementation/Integration Engineer
results.description:
Role: Implementation/Integration Engineer

At Revnue, we are bringing the future of AI-powered contract management to the world. We believe AI has the ability to provide deep insights into contracts to businesses everywhere. Our extensible platform brings full traceability across Contracts, Assets, SaaS, Suppliers, and Customers for all organizations of all sizes and verticals. With Revnue, we are empowering businesses to uncover the enormous value hidden within contracts.  

Come join us where you'll have amazing growth potential and opportunities to help shape the future of Revnue and ensure customer success.

Job Summary:

  • Exciting Contract Management SaaS poised for growth and international expansion
  • Experienced leadership team with a great culture and fun place to work

 

About the Job:

We are looking for an Implementation/Integration Engineer to play a role in owning the Revnue platform integrations. Someone who can effectively communicate the impact of integrations on business processes and convey the importance of a strategy. As an Implementation/Integration Engineer, you are responsible for integration project delivery and success. You will be expected to contribute to optimizing and automating the company's integration landscape over the next few years by implementing and supporting scalable business processes to support the company's growth and initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, implement and support interfaces and integrations across a broad range of systems — including commercial applications and custom-built solutions.
  • Evaluate existing components or systems to determine integration requirements and ensure that the final solutions meet organizational needs.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to team members to solve problems and oversee the usage of best practices and technologies.
  • Collaborate regularly with other departments to improve processes or procedures
  • Manage multiple client implementations simultaneously
  • Conduct review with customer prior to release to confirm acceptance of data and configuration
  • Build solutions with custom frontends and backend services that automate business processes.
  • Integrate third-party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems.
  • Accurately forecast activation dates and manage implementation appropriately to meet release dates
  • Interpret and understand client business requirements
  • Identify, assist and test enhancements to workflow, scripts, or system defects for core functions
  • Conduct quality assurance of data migrations prior to release to the customer
  • Integrate Revnue across different platforms
  • Other tasks that may be assigned to you related to your role.



Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Graduate's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in using IPaaS tools (Make, Celigo, Workato, Integrately, Zapier is mandatory)
  • Knowledgeable with API's, experience with Javascript and Python is a plus
  • Knowledge of best practices in integration standards and approaches
  • Willingness to learn, accept new ideas and be independent
  • Self-starter who can communicate, organize, make decisions, solve problems, and manage time well



Revnue is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Revnue is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or another legally protected status.

results.title: Software Engineer 2158 HMIS NWSOL
results.description:
Location: Richland, WA
Title: Software Engineer
Schedule (FT/PT): FT
Travel Required: As Needed
Clearance: Ability to Obtain

North Wind Solutions is a Government contracting small business with operations at military and civilian installations across the United States. The company's focus is facilities operation and maintenance, waste management and radiological services, security control and force protection, and environmental services.

Job Description

The North Wind Enterprise Application Services organization develops and maintains hundreds of custom and commercial-off-the-shelf software applications at the Hanford Site in Richland, WA. This is one of the largest environmental cleanup projects in the world, focused on river protection, habitat restoration, and environmental remediation. The enterprise is in the midst of a major modernization effort towards a more agile methodology. In this phase of the transformation, the organization must maintain current software development processes while implementing new, agile processes alongside them.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position will be part of a strong team providing software engineering support to design, develop, operate and maintain software programs. Software engineering support also includes the assessment, maintenance, documentation, modernization, testing, and implementation functions. Responsibilities may include both the the production of new systems and web applications and support of legacy systems.

The software engineer will provide development and support for a variety of custom applications, as well as integration of Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) products into the enterprise ecosystem. Support and development will include .NET, ColdFusion and other programming languages with back-end databases developed in Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle.

The software engineer is responsible for designing, building, and implementing software. Specific duties include but are not limited to the following:

  • Develop and maintain software using .NET and other technologies
  • Design databases and work closely with SQL and/or Oracle database administrators to implement them into production environments
  • Understand and follow modern agile Software Development Lifecycle processes & procedures
  • Work and follow best practices in a DevSecOps environment, in close collaboration with Infrastructure and Cybersecurity colleagues
  • Work closely with customers, project managers, and other developers to understand user needs and deliver elegant solutions
  • Design and develop test cases
  • Analyze and monitor existing systems to provide recommendations for improvement
  • Troubleshoot software production issues
  • Assist with providing estimates
  • Assist with gathering requirements from customers
  • Develop technical documentation
  • Provide recommendations for continuous improvements

This software engineer will be expected to work independently with general supervision, resolve problems and issues with a wide array of knowledge and use leadership abilities to influence others within the job area through explanation of facts, policies and practices.

    Qualifications

    Education and Experience:

    • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field OR a combination of education and work experience plus 3-4 years of related experience in computer application development and/or COTS support.
    • Minimum of 3 years' relevant experience in a multi-platform environment in application and database development with significant involvement in developing projects using .NET technology.
    • Minimum of 1 year of experience with AzureDevOps and/or the Agile Framework.

    Desired Experience

    • Experience working on Project Controls/Financial applications and systems
    • Experience developing in Cold Fusion
    • Experience working in a DevSecOps environment
    • · Experience developing applications using Git source control

    Skills and Abilities:

    • You have proven strong organizational skills, as well as working under tight deadlines
    • You have a commitment to teamwork and collaboration that is grounded in your capacity for empathy
    • You are passionate about clear communication and equally comfortable with written and verbal communications mediums
    • You are highly self-motivated and self-directed
    • You have the vision and mindset to identify, handle, and resolve problems quickly before they become recurring issues
    • You are a lifelong learner who displays adaptability in the face of changing circumstances
    • You have a honed sense of professionalism and analytical skill around office procedures and equipment such as telephone communications, business processes, and record-keeping
    • You have the ability to navigate problems and work independently, with some general supervision
    • You are familiar with  software quality assurance and software testing principles    

    SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

    • Proof of USA citizenship will be required as a condition of employment.
    • Must pass pre-employment background check
    • Must pass pre-employment drug screening
    • Applicants are required to have REAL ID ACT compliant documentation at time of hire and nothing on record that would prohibit you from gaining access to Department of Energy sites

    WORKING ENVIRONMENT:

    This is a remote position.

      North Wind offers a competitive pay and benefits package to include health, life, and disability insurance benefits, 401(k) with company match, generous paid leave and tuition reimbursement for eligible employees. As a company, we are committed to employee wellness, professional development, and work-life balance. We value safety, reliability, and commitment to our people! For more information about our benefits or hiring philosophy, visit the North Wind Career Opportunities Page.

      Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The nature of those accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact our Helpline +1.208.528.8718 or use the Request for Reasonable Accommodation form to get assistance.

      North Wind is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, religion, or other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

      Proof of citizenship will be required as a condition of employment.

      Candidates may be required to obtain and hold a Secret or Higher US Government Clearance.

results.description:
Position: Backend JS Lead
 
Who We Are?
 
We build Nx. Nx is a smart, fast and extensible build tool for JavaScript with excellent support for monorepos. 1.5+ million developers, and 50%+ of Fortune 500 companies rely on Nx.
 
Currently, Nx is most widely used in the React and Angular communities. We just raised USD$8.5m to make Nx the default build tool across the JavaScript ecosystem.
 
 
Why Join Nx?
 
Live and work in places you love
We are a distributed company with central offices in Toronto and Phoenix, but our team is spread all over North America and Europe.
 
At Nx, you get to decide when and how you work best. Whether you want to spend a week working remotely from a coffee shop in Barcelona, or you're a night owl who wants to work in the evening — it’s your choice. You know what makes you most productive and happy. Do that!
 
Work with smart, friendly, and fun people
We care less about your resume: where you worked at and how many  years of experience you have. What matters most to us is whether you are a great engineer who likes what they do, and whether you can do amazing work.
 
Trust your company and your colleagues
Above all, we value transparency and honesty. Everyone knows how much money the company is making. Everyone knows how much everyone else is making. We don’t have behind the scenes negotiations, departmental silos, or company politics.
 
We have:
 
Vacation and Sick Days: We want everyone to have fulfilling lives outside work and spend more time with their families and friends. That’s why we provide 4 weeks of vacation and unlimited sick days.
 
Competitive Salaries: We pay really well because in addition to providing a great work environment we also want you to live comfortably. Salary depends on your level and is non-negotiable.
 
Health, Dental & Vision Insurance: We offer health, dental, and vision plans for all employees.
 
No Red Tape Attitude Towards Expenses: You can get the best hardware, software, office supplies, books. Large purchases will be approved the same day.
 
Remote Work: Work from our Phoenix offices, work from home, work from anywhere you want.
 
See for more information on the company https://nrwl.io/careers
 
Who We Are Looking For?
 
We are looking for someone who can make Nx the best build tool for Node.js APIs, edge and cloud functions. They should understand developer needs and what is lacking in the backend space for TS/JS.
 
You must have:
 
Rich experience in writing JavaScript on the backend (APIs, functions, lambda, edge).
Familiarity with different JavaScript communities (e.g., Node.js, Deno).
A deep appreciation of good tooling, ideally some experience in building some

results.title: (Senior) Embedded Engineer
results.description:
About Vay:

At Vay, we pioneer change. We do work that has never been done before. We have a vision that we are excited to work for: To solve transportation in metropolitan areas.

We are developing an alternative approach to autonomous driving called teledriving. With our teledrive-first-approach we aim to offer a sustainable and safe service that can be an alternative to existing mobility services.

This is very ambitious. And we can’t do it alone. So we'd love to meet you!

Our team combines talent from multiple worlds: from automotive and safety engineering to software, product, regulatory, operations and many more. It is not only our technology that follows a human centred approach, but in everything we do, we keep the user's perspective and needs front of mind. This approach and the mix of talent creates a unique and stimulating work environment.

 

The Role:
 

As (Senior) Embedded Engineer at Vay, you will be developing safety critical firmware on bare metal which will be running on Vay’s driverless vehicle fleet on public roads. Together with the rest of the Engineering teams at Vay, you would push the boundaries of established norms and standards for shipping safety critical systems in the automotive industry. We thrive in complexity and ambiguity. We hope you do, too.

 

Vay is building a full-stack solution for rolling out higher levels of autonomous mobility using teleoperation technology on a massive scale. This requires us to move away from the R&D mode and focus on what it takes to get us to production level quality for a highly complex system which conforms to the functional safety (ISO 26262) expectations. 

 

You won't only drive the best practices from the automotive world but also think outside the box and apply the latest modern embedded development techniques for shipping Hardware and Firmware products with the high quality and on time.

You have:
 
  • 5+ years experience in developing safety critical code in industries which have no room for an error like automotive and aerospace
  • Mentality to work in cross functional teams to develop the requirements and software architecture for our embedded and robotics systems
  • Experience with on ISO 26262 certified products with safety levels up to ASIL D or related safety level from different industry
  • Experience with RTOS platforms
  • Experience in low level communications protocols (CAN, CAN FD, LIN)
  • Strong C programming skills applied to embedded MCU targets
  • Experience in low memory constrained environments
  • Experience with debugging tools (such as Lauterbach) and methods for embedded targets
  • A record of owning projects successfully and working in a fast paced environment
  • Experience writing concise, clear, and detailed engineering documentation with strong presentation and communication skills. 
 
Nice To Have’s:
 
  • Ability to understand PCB schematic and layout documents
  • Experience with multicore microcontrollers, e.g. from Infineon, Renesas, NXP
  • Experience with FPGA development
  • Previous experience in developing drive-by-wire systems
  • Familiar with middleware frameworks like ROS

Our values

  • We pioneer change: At Vay, we’re doing work that has never been done before. This comes with challenges, frustrations and failures along the way. We embrace these challenges through perseverance and innovation, delivering creative solutions to overcome them.

  • We fuel collaboration: At Vay, we work as a team and strive for a common goal. We celebrate diversity and encourage different opinions. Our teams and partners communicate and collaborate openly. Together we build, improve, and grow.

  • We drive action: At Vay, everyone takes pride and commitment in their role for every task and every challenge. We are biassed towards action and get behind the steering wheel, even when there is none. We are empowered to take initiative and drive it to completion.

  • We build trust: At Vay, we consistently do the right thing, and follow through on our commitments to stakeholders, users and society. We understand their expectations and always respond in a way that feels human and respectful. We always put safety first and safety second.

  • We create magic: At Vay, we don’t just make things that work, we build products people love. We create unexpected and delightful moments for our riders. We design end-to-end experiences that leave a lasting expression.


Additional benefits:

  • You’ll be joining a highly committed, experienced, fun, and international team from over 30 countries. The team has previously worked at companies such as Tesla, Google, Waymo, Zoox, Byton, Argo, Amazon, Uber as well as Audi, BMW, and Daimler and has founded various companies before

  • You would be a part of solving transportation in metropolitan areas all over the world – from Europe

  • We organize thoughtful & fun team events throughout the year

  • We support highly flexible working policies

  • We provide healthy snacks, drinks, and coffee at our waterfront office in Berlin

 

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

Vay is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

Come join the future!

results.title: Embedded QT Developer - C/C++/QT
results.description:
Who you are about to join
  • NGRAVE is a leading blockchain technology provider bringing easy-to-use maximum security solutions to cryptocurrency and digital asset investors.
  • After witnessing with our own eyes and portfolios how several millions of dollars keep vanishing on a daily basis, we just couldn’t sit idly by. So in 2018, we decided to take matters into our own hands and build the most secure solution for digital assets the world has ever seen.
  • In 2021, we launched our award winning 3-tier product offering: “ZERO”, the only crypto (hardware) wallet in the world with the highest security certification (EAL7); “GRAPHENE”, the most advanced key backup in the world; and “LIQUID”, our mobile app where users can see their real-time portfolio, as well as receive and initiate transactions.
  • Selling in 90 countries, we have entered the early scale-up phase with a rapidly growing team and beyond exciting plans for 2022.
  • Our partners include the world’s top tier in nanotechnology, applied industrial cryptography and hardware- and firmware- security, as well as thought leaders such as Jean-Jacques Quisquater: one of blockchain’s founding fathers and second reference of the bitcoin paper.
  • Awards include AIBC's "Crypto Wallet of the Year 2021", ScaleUp.eu's “Disruptive Innovator of the Year 2021”, Google, PwC and Trends' “Digital Pioneer 2020" and several more.
 
Job Description

As an Embedded Software Engineer at NGRAVE, you work at the core of our product offerings. You work together with hardware and software developers to guarantee the secure & robust working of our existing products, especially our hardware wallet. You are also responsible for managing the implementation of new features according to our ambitious roadmap that is at the forefront of security innovation in the crypto space.

As an ideal candidate, you have prior experience with designing, implementing, and deploying code that is easy to test and maintain.

Responsibilities

  • Developing and maintaining software for embedded systems using C/C++ and Qt
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new features and functionality
  • Ensuring the security of our hardware and software systems
  • Troubleshooting and debugging software and hardware issues
  • Writing and maintaining documentation for software and hardware systems
  • Staying up-to-date with the latest developments and trends in embedded development
Skills and Qualifications
  • A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience

  • At least 3 years of experience with C/C++ and Qt

  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities

  • Nice to have:

    • Experience working with embedded systems

    • Experience with security (both hardware and software)

    • Familiarity with Rust

    • Being a crypto and blockchain enthusiast

    • Familiar with Qt QA tools (Axivion, Squish, Coco)

 

What’s in it for you

  • Join a promising and award-winning young company backed by top funds from the USA, Europe and Asia, featured in Forbes, Bloomberg, Entrepreneur, Cointelegraph, Crunchbase, Bitcoinist, and others, in its high-growth stage.

  • In our next phase we will expand the R&D and day-to-day IT operations teams, as well as set up hubs in other continents to increase our sales. This creates great opportunities to make your mark, have real impact, and rise to your ambitions.

  • Work on a daily basis with passionate people who love what they do.

  • We are obsessed with lifelong learning. If you are into that too, you’ve come to the right place. We make it our mission to help you become a better version of yourself, starting by setting up a development plan together.

  • Highly competitive and flexible salary package with ample fringe benefits including group- and hospitalization insurance, (optional) company car with fuel card + parking cost and car wash retribution, meal vouchers, mac book, iphone with telco subscription, internet, home working.

  • A flat organization where your opinion matters.

  • 29 official vacation days.

  • A place in our dedicated office at a top location in Brussels with great architecture, food courts, restaurants, parks, and after-work drink occasion; nearby the Brussels North railway station including free shuttle service.

 

 

 

Together, we can empower ever more people and businesses to be the master of their own financial fate, bringing them true peace-of-mind.

results.title: Frontend Developer (JavaScript + React)
results.description:
We are looking for a Frontend Developer to join our engineering team as we have too many ideas and not enough developers :-)

The salary for this position is €63,000 annually, plus great benefits (see below). We are committed to increasing salaries every year based on company and individual performance.

You can work from anywhere in Europe.

 
About the team

Toggl Hire is on a mission to revolutionize the way hiring happens. We are big believers that modern day recruiting should be effortless and enjoyable. That means no more resumes or cover letters, no more endless hours screening through applications, no more interpreting past roles into current experience, no more bias and gut feeling, but informed decisions based on data.

We are a fully remote team, with headquarters in Tallinn, Estonia. We are highly skilled, highly motivated, and most importantly, a fun, friendly bunch. We value transparency, communication and results over effort and excuses. We have regular in-person meetups all over the world!

The engineering team has a Product Manager, a Designer, a Lead Engineer, 3 frontend and 3 backend developers. We also help the other 2 developers focusing on the growth experiments and their Product Manager.

We have been recently named as one of the best remote companies to work at.

 
The role

As a Frontend Developer your main responsibilities will be:

  • Working independently with minimal supervision and handholding
  • Building and maintaining product features, ensuring performance, security and scalability
  • Finding best possible technical solution for new features implementation
  • Contributing to technical design and architecture with a steep growth in mind
  • Doing code reviews or researching and implementing new tools when needed.
 
About you/Requirements

You will fit in well in our team if:

  • You have demonstrated strong experience working with large SaaS data infrastructure.
  • You are a great team-player and communicator when working with anyone from engineers to specialists like product managers and when working with other teams, and with your manager and other stakeholders. You are responsive to feedback and always seek to learn and improve.
  • You can come up with creative approaches to problem solving and can provide feedback to others on their work, be it your fellow developers, the designer or the product manager
  • You always approach new challenges with a critical thinking mindset and make sure to look at the big picture.
  • You want to take ownership and work independently while being part of a tight-knit team.
  • You have efficient time management skills as well as the eagerness to learn new skills and tools are something you value.
  • You have a strong engineering background and enjoy the startup life. You have seen many projects through from conception to delivery.

The main technologies you will be working with are:

  • JavaScript, Typescript, React, GraphQL, Heroku, AWS, CircleCI.
  • We use Golang and PostgreSQL in the backend.
 
Some benefits
  • Freedom to choose when and how much you work - we only measure results
  • 24 days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays
  • In-person meetups for team-building (expenses covered)
  • 4-6 weeks paid sabbatical (depending on the tenure)
  • Laptop budget up to €2,500 and it renews every 3 years
  • €2,000 budget to set up your home office, and additional €300 every year after 3 years of tenure
  • €250 per month for co-working space membership and/or internet service at home
  • €4,000 per year contribution to use for training, workshops, and conferences
  • €2,000 per year contribution for any equipment or services to improve and/or maintain your physical and mental health
  • Support for buying tools you need for doing your best work (even eyeglasses if you need a new pair)

results.title: Senior Software Engineer
results.description:
Real Vision helps people understand the complex world of finance, business, and the global economy with real in-depth analysis by real experts through the power of its community.

The company is on a mission to democratize the very best financial intelligence for all and become the one place where everyone lives their financial lives.

This enhanced platform will offer members different learning journeys that put them in control of their finances. Members will be able to watch videos, listen to podcasts, monitor market prices, analyze markets and economies, do technical analysis, create watch lists, read and publish research, monitor their portfolios, execute trades across both Tradfi and Crypto, and contribute to a thriving hive mind community.

To help us get there, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help create scalable software solutions.


What you'll do:
  • Thinking out of the box to develop innovative solutions that scale, are resilient, secure, maintainable, and elegant.
  • Partner with design and product to create and evangelize a world-class B2C & B2B FinTech Platform
  • Collaborate across engineering and business disciplines to meet the aggressive vision and scheduled releases.
  • Individually contribute directly to software development efforts across various projects, frameworks, and test suites.
  • Work with other developers to understand and assess needs for backend APIs 
  • Provide actively code reviews with quality / actionable comments on pull requests 
  • Research and experiment with the implementation of the latest technologies to address the green field development and overall development process.
  • Writing clean, efficient, secure, modular, well-documented, reusable code that is easy to read and understand by other team members.

results.title: Native Mobile Developers (iOS/Android)
results.description:
Hi 👋🏾 I’m Noel Baron and I’m the Co-Founder and CTO at Post. Noam Bardin (original CEO of Waze, my co-founder and CEO) and I believe that a small talented team given the right environment can build high-quality software fast (and sleep soundly at night while systems are running!).

Post recently launched beta and we are growing quickly. Below are some of the roles we are actively looking for. If you do not fit into these categories, please still apply and tell us more about yourself. We are always looking to connect with great engineers.

  • Senior - Principal AWS Typescript Engineers: Lambda, Event Driven Architecture, Dynamo, scale & social applications. Cognito Expertise (Social Sign In) is our biggest need there.

  • React Seniors: Engineers with extensive React or Vue experience who would be open to learning SOLID.js, SSR experience also appreciated.

  • Automation Engineers: people who love to write the automated tests for FRONT and BACK end.

  • Recommendations/ML

  • Data Engineering

  • Native Mobile Developers (iOS/Andriod)

  • Graph/Search Specialists

We are excited to open these positions because they have many of the responsibilities I wanted as an engineer and made me successful when I had them (which was rare!). As a product engineer, you’ll take ownership over a large portion of one of our products and own many micro-projects end-to-end (wearing hats traditionally worn by product and design). You’ll, for example, research competitors, write product specs, document code, and implement features from frontend to backend (where applicable). To ground it with examples, product engineers at Post have:

  • Content ingestion systems that feed news content from Publishers into consumable social media posts on our platform.

  • Designed local developer experiences that rely on best-practice tooling like ESLint, Prettier, and a host of continuous integration/deployment tools. 

  • Cross-service serverless API endpoints designed to streamline how services communicate with one another in both internal and external contexts.

These projects are also a reflection of what we’re trying to accomplish at Post: improving the productivity of working professionals (starting with talented teams) with intelligent and powerful software. We put a lot of effort into designing products that are approachable to beginners but mastered & extended by power users. In many ways, spreadsheets set the bar here.

There’s not much out there about us but we have lots of paying customers that love us and we are well funded by brand name silicon valley investors. I’ll share more once we meet.

One formality, we do require that you can provide 40+ hours of dedicated time to our mission. This is a startup, and this position will give you a seat at our early-employee’s table but will be expected to work hard and perform miracles.

 

Engineering Culture

 

Collaboration is Natural & Communication is Deliberate

Our engineering team (and team at large) consists of lifelong learners who are humble and kind. It’s something we filter for in interviews and creates an environment where collaboration happens naturally. We combine this with research, prototyping, and written proposals to see around corners and get feedback from the team across time zones. Focus time is something that we hold sacred, and, with thoughtful and deliberate communication, engineers are able to focus 36h out of a 40h work week.   

Increase Leverage not Team Size

We built Post Media with the quality, breadth, and depth that many customers would expect from much larger teams over larger time scales. We’ve done this through investment in:

  • Great developer tooling. Our CI/CD takes ~10m and we deploy at least 5x a day. Everyone on the team has contributed to developer experience 💪🏾

  • Common building blocks to build powerful and customizable products fast. At the core of Post is a set of common components (analytics modeling and query language, policy engine, workflow engine, design system) which we are constantly improving. Each improvement to a common component cascades throughout our app.

Give Engineers Ownership & Autonomy

We, as engineers, find clever ways to solve problems and that amplifies when we deeply understand the problem. We did our best work as engineers when we had a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution. Our engineering culture reflects this experience: engineers own projects end-to-end from speaking with users to writing product specs to UX design. These are skills that we often don’t get to practice as engineers, and, at Post, we provide mentorship to improve them and help from the team where you want it.

Put Effort into Diversity 

Diverse teams drive innovation and better outcomes. I want to make sure Post creates opportunities for the next generation of engineers from underrepresented groups. We are taking conscious steps to improve like sourcing diverse candidates, providing generous PTO, no leetcode interviews, and more.

 

Technology Stack

I’m sharing our tech stack with the caveat that we don’t require previous experience in it (but love of typed languages is helpful). TypeScript (frontend & backend), Node.js, Solid.js (Solid Start SSR), Postgres, AWS Serverless Architecture, Redshift, Redis, and Dynamo.

 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and equity.

  • Unlimited PTO with 4 weeks recommended per year.  Expect “Vacation?” in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it 😅.

  • Remote first. Unlimited coworking passes (e.g. WeWork) as needed. 

  • Top notch health insurance for you and your dependents, plus FSA, DCFSA, HSA, STD, LTD, basic life insurance coverage and free membership access to One Medical. 

Post’s success hinges on us hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We’re being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.

Post provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.
